title: Homepage initial load performance
description: Verify that the homepage loads within 2 seconds on a typical 3G connection or that a documented performance optimization plan is available.

steps.description: Simulate loading the homepage on a 3G network environment
Verify the page content renders and becomes interactive within 2 seconds or an appropriate fallback strategy or optimization plan is logged

title: Hero section displays correctly with animated background
description: Check that the hero section renders the full-bleed area with engaging visuals and primary calls-to-action are visible.

steps.description: Navigate to the homepage
Verify the hero section is full width and height as per design
Verify presence of introductory text and primary call-to-action buttons
Verify that the animated background component plays animation when user preference for reduced motion is not set

title: Animated backgrounds respect reduced-motion preference
description: Ensure that the Animated Background component disables animations or reduces motion if the user has set system preferences for reduced motion.

steps.description: Set system user preference to reduced motion
Load the homepage
Verify the animated background is static or has reduced animation according to accessibility guidelines

title: Projects section renders project cards with filtering
description: Verify that the projects section displays project cards with images, descriptions, tech tags, and links, and supports filtering by categories or technologies.

steps.description: Navigate to the projects section
Verify that all project cards display with an image, description, technology tags, and links to source code and live demo
Use the filtering controls to select a specific project category or technology
Verify only projects matching the filter criteria are shown
Clear all filters
Verify all projects are visible again

title: Projects detail view accessibility and correctness
description: Clicking a project card opens a modal or navigates to a detail page showing screenshots, descriptions, tech stack, live demos, and supports carousel where applicable.

steps.description: Click on a project card
Verify a modal or detail page opens with detailed project information
Verify all images and screenshots load correctly; fallback placeholder is used if any image fails to load
Verify tech stack and descriptions are present and accurate
Verify controls to view demo or repository links are present and functional
Verify carousel navigation works if multiple images/screenshots are present

title: Empty projects list displays friendly placeholder
description: Verify that when no projects match the filter criteria or the project list is empty, a friendly placeholder message is shown.

steps.description: Apply filters that match no projects or simulate empty projects data
Verify that a friendly user-facing message indicating no projects are available is displayed

title: Skills section visual and content verification
description: Verify the skills section correctly displays skills grouped by frontend, backend, and tools, with appropriate icons or progress indicators representing competency.

steps.description: Navigate to the skills section
Verify skill groups for frontend, backend, and tools exist
Verify each skill displays an icon or progress indicator reflecting competency

title: Contact form client-side validation and submission success
description: Verify that the contact form validates inputs in real-time and on submission, submits data successfully and provides appropriate success feedback.

steps.description: Navigate to the contact section
Fill the form with valid name, email, and message
Verify real-time validation shows no errors
Submit the form
Verify inline loading indicator appears
Verify success toast notification is shown

title: Contact form client-side validation error handling
description: Verify that the contact form shows appropriate validation errors for incomplete or invalid inputs before submission.

steps.description: Navigate to the contact section
Input invalid email format and leave required fields empty
Verify that real-time validation marks invalid fields and displays error messages
Attempt to submit the form
Verify submission is blocked and errors are shown

title: Contact form handles API failure with retry and preserves input
description: Confirm that when the contact API call fails, the form displays failure feedback, provides a retry option, and preserves user input.

steps.description: Fill the contact form with valid data
Simulate contact API failure on form submission
Submit the form
Verify failure toast notification is shown with retry option
Verify form inputs retain the user's data after failure
Click retry and simulate successful API call
Verify success toast is shown and form clears or disables further input

title: Contact section social profile links and résumé download
description: Verify contact section provides functional links to social profiles and allows downloading a résumé file.

steps.description: Navigate to the contact section
Verify social profile links are present
Click on each social link
Verify links open the correct social profiles in a new tab or window
Verify a résumé download link/button is present
Click résumé download link
Verify résumé file downloads successfully

title: Responsive navigation bar functionality on desktop and mobile
description: Verify the sticky navbar with anchor links works correctly on desktop and mobile, including the collapsible mobile menu with touch-friendly interactions.

steps.description: Resize browser to desktop width and load homepage
Verify sticky navbar remains visible on scroll
Click each navbar anchor link
Verify page scrolls smoothly to the corresponding section and URL hash updates accordingly
Resize browser to mobile width
Verify navbar menu collapses into a hamburger icon
Tap hamburger icon to expand mobile menu
Verify menu expands and anchor links are touch friendly
Tap on a mobile navigation link
Verify page scrolls to section and mobile menu collapses

title: Keyboard accessibility for all interactive elements
description: Ensure that all interactive components including navbar links, project cards, contact form inputs and buttons, toast notifications, and filtering controls are operable via keyboard only.

steps.description: Use keyboard tabbing through the entire page in sequential order
Verify focus states are visible on all interactive elements
Activate interactive elements using keyboard controls (Enter, Space)
Verify expected behaviors occur (navigation, modals open, form inputs focus, etc.)
Verify keyboard can close any open modals or menus

title: Images load with lazy loading and fallback placeholders
description: Test that images (project cards, hero section, skills icons) use optimized lazy loading and display fallback placeholders when image loading fails.

steps.description: Load homepage and scroll through sections
Verify images lazy load as they come into the viewport
Simulate image load failure for a project card or hero section image
Verify a fallback placeholder image or icon is shown instead

title: Reusable UI components consistency
description: Verify buttons, cards, inputs, and toast notifications used throughout the site maintain consistent styling, behavior, and accessibility compliance.

steps.description: Navigate through various site sections: Hero, Projects, Skills, Contact
Verify buttons share consistent styling, hover/focus behavior, and accessible labels
Verify cards have consistent sizing, shadows, and layout
Verify input fields have consistent styling and validation feedback
Trigger toast notifications on success and failure (e.g. contact form submissions)
Verify toasts appear consistently with correct style, accessibility roles, and dismissal functionality

title: Accessibility audit: ARIA roles, semantic markup, and color contrast compliance
description: Run an accessibility audit to verify the website meets standards for ARIA roles, semantic HTML structure, keyboard navigation, and sufficient color contrast.

steps.description: Run automated accessibility tools (e.g. axe, Lighthouse) on all main pages and sections
Verify no critical accessibility violations are reported
Verify ARIA roles are applied appropriately (e.g. alerts for toast, navigation landmarks for navbar)
Verify semantic HTML tags are used correctly (header, nav, main, section, footer)
Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards
